Articles.Content: I stranded one of my mun landers in a botched landing and when I sent my rescue party out to it I found out the lander, debris, and flag I planted ended up glitching 100m under the Mun surface. I was wondering if there is any way to possibly fix it or do I have to destroy the debris and lose one of my kerbals?

If they are truly below the surface, I would think they would fall down into the center of the MÃƒÂ¼n. If they are just sitting there, it might be a graphical glitch and you can just walk up to them. If they are on the surface but below the MÃƒÂ¼n's "sea" level, then they might be stuck forever.

If that doesn't help, they are probably doomed. The only other thing I can think of would be to hurl something at them and try to knock them free without destroying them.

I've had a similar situation. Jebediah fell down, and i switched to Bob before he got back up. He started doing weird glitchy movements under the lander, and as soon as i switched back to him he fell clean through the surface of the moon, about a hundred or so metres down and got stuck there. Luckily Jeb came in a one man ship, and the lander he was visiting had two crewmembers, so i was able to end his flight and fly both ships back home.

With .21, i don't know anymore though. My suggestion, if you have the same problem as me, would be trying to find out how many metres below the surface you are, then editing your persistance file to un-glitch it.

My problem was a lot like yours Spyritdragon. As I was driving up towards the stranded lander, it somehow disappeared below the surface and was stuck there unable to do anything. I ended up just destroying the lander in the tracking station and losing Philming. Thanks for the help though.
